result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: Christopher Stephen Petros DF: Melissa Esther Winther appeared. Case called at 10:29. Includes 14CF484, 15CF162. Court reviews PSI that was completed previously as a result of a conviction out of Eau Claire County. ADA Hartung updates the court, they are prepared to do a plea and sentincing today.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1 in 14CF484. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 14CF484. On motion of the State, Crt reads in and dismisses Ct 2 and 3 in 14CF484 and reads in and dismisses 15CF162. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. Crt orders: Sentence W/H
3 years probation to be served concurrent with the Eau Claire County case 
Conditions of probation:
- Court notes 7 days credit against any ultimate sentence.
- Victim Empathy panel or panels
- DE to maintain current mental health treatment. 
- DE to complete 80 hours of community service
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.
- Costs

Court extends 7 days to the state for a restitution number.   
Court does not object to probation to be transferred to county of residence. 
Eau Claire County PSI is to be sealed. DE to sign up for probation today.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 28, 2016 at 10:15 am.
Copy of PSI from Eau Claire Co. File. hml
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-22-2016 03:30 pm

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: Christopher Stephen Petros DF: Melissa Esther Winther appeared. Case called at 3:30. Includes 14CF484, 15CF162. Scheduled for a plea hearing today. ADA Hartung updates the court. DE has 2 other charges in Eau Clair and Chippewa. DE entered a plea in Eau Claire and is being sentenced on March 11, 2016. Atty. Petros responds. Eau Claire county is conducting a PSI.  Eau Clarie County has opened up the PSI to Chippewa County and St. Croix County. Address confirmed. Bond continues.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 22, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Plea hearing at 02-08-2016 03:30 pm

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: Christopher Stephen Petros DF: Melissa Esther Winther appeared. Case called at 11:08. Includes 14CF484, 15CF162.  Atty. Petros updates the court. On 15CF162 Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court orders State to provide discovery on 15CF162.  Arraignment scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 10:00 am.

per Defendant in court. gme

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Cash Store.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
